rOstluft.plot 0.0.0.9005
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Kalender_Linie

Summarise z values over binned wind data.

Source: R/summary_wind.R
summary_wind.Rd

Input data should be original unbinned data. 1-dimensional binning and calculating summary statistics over wind direction and/or wind velocity bins, respectively. NA values in z will be silently removed before applying functions

summary_wind(data, ws, wd, z, groups = c(), fun = "mean",
  fun.args = list(), nmin = 3, wd_cutfun = cut_wd.fun(binwidth = 45),
  ws_cutfun = cut_ws.fun(binwidth = 1))

Arguments

data

a data.frame or tibble containing the data (wide format)
ws

symbol giving the wind velocity parameter name (wind velocity preferably in m/s)
wd

symbol giving the wind direction parameter name in degrees
z

symbol giving the parameter name to be summarised
groups

one or more character string for additional grouping
fun

function or list of functions for summary.
fun.args

a list of extra arguments passed on to fun.
nmin

numeric, minimum number of values for fun, if n < nmin: NA is returned
wd_cutfun

function, cut function for wind direction (to create bins). See wd_cut.fun() for options.
ws_cutfun

function, cut function for wind speed. See ws_cut.fun() for examples

Value

a tibble with summarised data

Computed variables

The names of the columns stay the same as in data (for the arguments "ws", "wd" and "z").

  • binned column ws

  • binned column wd

  • factor column stat containing the name of the summarize function as level

  • column z with the result of the summarize function

  • n count of occurrences for the corresponding bin

  • freq frequency of the corresponding bin

Examples

fn <- rOstluft.data::f("Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse_2010-2014.csv")
data <- rOstluft::read_airmo_csv(fn)
data <- rOstluft::rolf_to_openair(data)
data <- dplyr::mutate(data, year = lubridate::year(date))

summary_wind(data, "ws", "wd", "NO2")
#> # A tibble: 57 x 6
#>    wd    ws        n stat    NO2     freq
#>    <fct> <fct> <int> <fct> <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 0     [0,1]  3230 mean   43.6 0.0372  
#>  2 0     (1,2]  5764 mean   39.4 0.0664  
#>  3 0     (2,3]  2017 mean   36.7 0.0232  
#>  4 0     (3,4]   257 mean   32.7 0.00296 
#>  5 0     (4,5]    22 mean   19.9 0.000253
#>  6 45    [0,1]  3894 mean   44.6 0.0448  
#>  7 45    (1,2] 10172 mean   41.3 0.117   
#>  8 45    (2,3]  6036 mean   34.3 0.0695  
#>  9 45    (3,4]  1871 mean   28.0 0.0215  
#> 10 45    (4,5]   417 mean   24.5 0.00480 
#> # ... with 47 more rows

# works with symbols too and additional grouping
summary_wind(data, ws, wd, NO2, groups = c("site", "year"))
#> # A tibble: 235 x 8
#>    wd    ws    site                     year     n stat    NO2    freq
#>    <fct> <fct> <fct>                   <dbl> <int> <fct> <dbl>   <dbl>
#>  1 0     [0,1] Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse  2010   618 mean   45.9 0.00711
#>  2 0     [0,1] Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse  2011   637 mean   43.8 0.00733
#>  3 0     [0,1] Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse  2012   691 mean   41.9 0.00796
#>  4 0     [0,1] Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse  2013   632 mean   45.9 0.00728
#>  5 0     [0,1] Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse  2014   652 mean   40.7 0.00751
#>  6 0     (1,2] Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse  2010  1177 mean   42.6 0.0136 
#>  7 0     (1,2] Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse  2011  1228 mean   39.7 0.0141 
#>  8 0     (1,2] Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse  2012  1107 mean   38.0 0.0127 
#>  9 0     (1,2] Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse  2013  1164 mean   40.2 0.0134 
#> 10 0     (1,2] Zch_Stampfenbachstrasse  2014  1088 mean   36.1 0.0125 
#> # ... with 225 more rows

# multiple stats: Pass function, by name, reference, as function or one sided formula
q95 <- function(x) stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.95)

funs <- list(
  "mean",
  "median",
  "q95_1" = q95,
  "q95_2" = function(x) stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.95),
  "q95_3" = ~ stats::quantile(., probs = 0.95)
)

res <- summary_wind(data, "ws", "wd", "NO2", fun = funs)
res
#> # A tibble: 285 x 6
#>    wd    ws        n stat    NO2      freq
#>    <fct> <fct> <int> <fct> <dbl>     <dbl>
#>  1 0     [0,1]  3230 mean   43.6 0.00744  
#>  2 0     (1,2]  5764 mean   39.4 0.0133   
#>  3 0     (2,3]  2017 mean   36.7 0.00464  
#>  4 0     (3,4]   257 mean   32.7 0.000592 
#>  5 0     (4,5]    22 mean   19.9 0.0000507
#>  6 45    [0,1]  3894 mean   44.6 0.00897  
#>  7 45    (1,2] 10172 mean   41.3 0.0234   
#>  8 45    (2,3]  6036 mean   34.3 0.0139   
#>  9 45    (3,4]  1871 mean   28.0 0.00431  
#> 10 45    (4,5]   417 mean   24.5 0.000960 
#> # ... with 275 more rows

# and q95, q95_1, q95_2, q95_3 alle have the same value
tidyr::spread(res, "stat", "NO2") %>%
  dplyr::select(q95_1, q95_2, q95_3)
#> # A tibble: 57 x 3
#>    q95_1 q95_2 q95_3
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1  79.8  79.8  79.8
#>  2  74.2  74.2  74.2
#>  3  67.1  67.1  67.1
#>  4  79.6  79.6  79.6
#>  5  33.1  33.1  33.1
#>  6  81.6  81.6  81.6
#>  7  77.1  77.1  77.1
#>  8  65.4  65.4  65.4
#>  9  52.2  52.2  52.2
#> 10  45.4  45.4  45.4
#> # ... with 47 more rows

# is for some reason fun.args used with multiple functions, use ... to catch
# superfluous arguments:
funs <- list(
  "q95" = function(x, ...) stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.95),
  "mean"
)
summary_wind(data, "ws", "wd", "NO2", fun = funs, fun.args = list(na.rm = TRUE))
#> # A tibble: 114 x 6
#>    wd    ws        n stat    NO2     freq
#>    <fct> <fct> <int> <fct> <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 0     [0,1]  3230 q95    79.8 0.0186  
#>  2 0     (1,2]  5764 q95    74.2 0.0332  
#>  3 0     (2,3]  2017 q95    67.1 0.0116  
#>  4 0     (3,4]   257 q95    79.6 0.00148 
#>  5 0     (4,5]    22 q95    33.1 0.000127
#>  6 45    [0,1]  3894 q95    81.6 0.0224  
#>  7 45    (1,2] 10172 q95    77.1 0.0586  
#>  8 45    (2,3]  6036 q95    65.4 0.0347  
#>  9 45    (3,4]  1871 q95    52.2 0.0108  
#> 10 45    (4,5]   417 q95    45.4 0.00240 
#> # ... with 104 more rows


# more wd classes, less ws classes and squish ws
summary_wind(data, "ws", "wd", "NO",
             wd_cutfun = cut_wd.fun(binwidth = 22.5),
             ws_cutfun = cut_ws.fun(binwidth = 2, ws_max = 6))
#> # A tibble: 54 x 6
#>    wd    ws        n stat     NO      freq
#>    <fct> <fct> <int> <fct> <dbl>     <dbl>
#>  1 0     [0,2]  4225 mean  27.0  0.0486   
#>  2 0     (2,4]   931 mean  22.6  0.0107   
#>  3 0     (4,6]    17 mean   6.06 0.000196 
#>  4 22.5  [0,2]  8338 mean  34.5  0.0960   
#>  5 22.5  (2,4]  3290 mean  26.4  0.0379   
#>  6 22.5  (4,6]    22 mean  12.8  0.000253 
#>  7 45    [0,2]  7623 mean  28.4  0.0878   
#>  8 45    (2,4]  5228 mean  17.6  0.0602   
#>  9 45    (4,6]   446 mean   8.89 0.00513  
#> 10 45    >6        4 mean   3.19 0.0000461
#> # ... with 44 more rows

# only one ws class ()
summary_wind(data, "ws", "wd", "NO",
             ws_cutfun = function(x) factor("ws"))
#> # A tibble: 8 x 6
#>   wd    ws        n stat     NO   freq
#>   <fct> <fct> <int> <fct> <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 0     ws    11292 mean   27.8 0.130 
#> 2 45    ws    22480 mean   25.9 0.259 
#> 3 90    ws     2564 mean   21.1 0.0295
#> 4 135   ws     3422 mean   16.7 0.0394
#> 5 180   ws    13007 mean   18.3 0.150 
#> 6 225   ws    12088 mean   13.5 0.139 
#> 7 270   ws    13197 mean   14.8 0.152 
#> 8 315   ws     8809 mean   15.0 0.101
